qas.question: What is the movement of patients who need medical attention called?
Who coordinates the deployment of thee Aeromedical Evacuation?
Where does the Aeromedical Evacuation team transport casualties?

answers.text: to and between medical treatment facilities

qas.question: Who operates and is able to conduct airland missions?

context: <a0_0>Aeromedical Evacuation<a0_0/> is "the movement of patients under medical supervision to and between medical treatment facilities by air transportation" (JP 1-02). JP 4-02, <a1_0>Health Service Support<a1_0/>, further defines it as "the fixed wing movement of regulated casualties <a2_0>to and between medical treatment facilities<a2_0/>, using organic and/or contracted mobility airframes, with aircrew trained explicitly for this mission." <a3_0>Aeromedical evacuation forces<a3_0/> can operate as far forward as fixed-wing aircraft are able to conduct airland operations.
